rules.prover9_expression: (initiated(incident_response, team) -> (-(installed(antivirus, workstation) -> updated(antivirus, latest_definition)) -> identified(vulnerability, scanner)))
rules.natural: Provided that the team initiated incident response, if it is not the case that antivirus is installed on the workstation, then the antivirus is updated with the latest definition, which leads to the scanner identifying a vulnerability.
Under the condition that the manager approved remote access, the security incident is contained by the response.
Whenever the protocol requires forensic analysis, if the manager did not approve remote access, then the investigation is documented in the report.
Either the protocol requires forensic analysis or digital evidence is available from the system.
Should the lead investigator be assigned to the case, then the incident report is completed by the deadline.
Either the lead investigator is assigned to the case or the analysis task is delegated to the specialist.
If the employee device is authorized to use the network, then the backup data is encrypted using the algorithm.
Either the employee device is authorized to use the network or, when the monitoring system detects a security breach, the security incident is contained by the response.
Under the condition that the analyst reviewed the access logs, the security incident is contained by the response.
Provided that the expert examined the network traffic, the security incident is contained by the response.
If the monitoring identified suspicious activity, then the analyst reviewed the access logs.
Should the system detect unauthorized access, then the expert examined the network traffic.

If the tool automated log processing, then, under the condition that the procedure requires log analysis, either the monitoring identified suspicious activity or the system detected unauthorized access.
Either the tool automated log processing or the analyst performed a manual log review.
If the analyst performed a manual log review, then the log inspection is completed within the timeframe.
Under the condition that the backup recovery process is tested, the security incident is contained by the response.
If the data integrity of the backup is verified, then the security incident is contained by the response.

rules.prover9_expression: (deployed(patch_update, network) -> (-(tested(backup_recovery, process) | verified(data_integrity, backup)) -> restored(system_operation, normal)))
rules.natural: If the patch update is deployed across the network, then, under the condition that neither the backup recovery process is tested nor the data integrity of the backup is verified, the system operation is restored to normal.
If the admin initiated the rollback procedure, then the team executed the rollback plan.
Provided that the team executed the rollback plan, the system operation is restored to normal.
If access rights are conflicting with the policy, then it is not the case that privileged access is granted to the user.

rules.prover9_expression: (conflicting(access_rights, policy) | (-(-(tested(backup_recovery, process) | verified(data_integrity, backup)) -> affected(business_operation, incident)) -> minimized(disruption_time, response)))
rules.natural: Either access rights are conflicting with the policy or, if it is not true that the absence of both testing the backup recovery process and verifying the data integrity of the backup implies the incident affected business operation, then the response minimized disruption time.
Under the condition that the backup data is encrypted using the algorithm, the software update is compliant with the policy.
If the admin resolved the permission conflict, then, whenever access rights are conflicting with the policy, privileged access is granted to the user.
Provided that the access issue is escalated to management, if access rights are conflicting with the policy, then privileged access is granted to the user.
If the audit identified a permission violation, then the access control policy is corrected.
Either the audit identified a permission violation or the monitor discovered privilege abuse.
Under the condition that the monitor discovered privilege abuse, the access issue is escalated to management.
Whenever the access control policy is corrected, the admin resolved the permission conflict.
Either the team established a communication channel or status updates are maintained for management.

Provided that status updates are maintained for management, if the team lead coordinated the response effort, then, whenever the security patch is implemented on the system, the patch update is deployed across the network.
Under the condition that the isolation protocol is implemented on the network, the team activated the incident response plan.
Either the system achieved successful breach prevention or, if the team activated the incident response plan, the measures are effective for incident containment.
Either antivirus is installed on the workstation or the firewall is configured for the network.
Provided that the firewall is configured for the network, the attacker did not compromise the sensitive files.
Under the condition that the antivirus is updated with the latest definition, the attacker did not compromise the sensitive files.

If it is not the case that the availability of digital evidence from the system implies that, without manager approval of remote access, the investigation is documented in the report, then it is not the case that the evidence chain is preserved with integrity.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(delegated(analysis_task, specialist) -> (-(available(digital_evidence, system) -> (-approved(remote_access, manager) -> documented(investigation, report))) -> preserved(evidence_chain, integrity))) -> missed(reporting_deadline, team))
rules.natural: Provided that it is not true that delegating the analysis task to the specialist implies that, if the availability of digital evidence from the system does not lead to documenting the investigation in the report without manager approval of remote access, then the evidence chain is preserved with integrity, the team missed the reporting deadline.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(completed(log_inspection, timeframe) -> (required(log_analysis, procedure) -> (identified(suspicious_activity, monitoring) | detected(unauthorized_access, system)))) -> missed(critical_event, review))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that completing the log inspection within the timeframe implies that, whenever the procedure requires log analysis, either the monitoring identified suspicious activity or the system detected unauthorized access, then the review missed a critical event.
Should it be that neither the backup recovery process is tested nor the data integrity of the backup is verified, then the admin initiated the rollback procedure.
Provided that neither the backup recovery process is tested nor the data integrity of the backup is verified, it is not the case that the incident affected business operation.
Whenever it is not true that implementing the security patch on the system leads to deploying the patch update across the network, the patch caused a system outage.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(established(communication_channel, team) -> (coordinated(response_effort, team_lead) -> (implemented(security_patch, system) -> deployed(patch_update, network)))) -> delayed(response_time, communication))
rules.natural: Should it not be the case that establishing a communication channel by the team implies that, under the condition that the team lead coordinated the response effort, if the security patch is implemented on the system, the patch update is deployed across the network, then communication delayed the response time.
Provided that it is not true that installing antivirus on the workstation implies updating the antivirus with the latest definition, it is not the case that the scanner identified a vulnerability.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(-(tested(backup_recovery, process) | verified(data_integrity, backup)) -> affected(business_operation, incident)) -> -minimized(disruption_time, response))
rules.natural: If it is not true that the lack of either testing the backup recovery process or verifying the data integrity of the backup leads to the incident affecting business operation, then it is not the case that the response minimized disruption time.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(-(established(communication_channel, team) -> (coordinated(response_effort, team_lead) -> (implemented(security_patch, system) -> deployed(patch_update, network)))) -> -delayed(response_time, communication)) -> implemented(isolation_protocol, network))
rules.natural: Provided that it is not true that the absence of the implication from establishing a communication channel by the team to the coordinated deployment of the patch update, given the conditions, implies that communication did not delay the response time, the isolation protocol is implemented on the network.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(-(established(communication_channel, team) -> (coordinated(response_effort, team_lead) -> (implemented(security_patch, system) -> deployed(patch_update, network)))) -> -delayed(response_time, communication)) -> -effective(incident_containment, measures))
rules.natural: Should it not be the case that the lack of the implication from the team establishing a communication channel to the patch deployment under coordination implies that communication did not delay the response time, then it is not the case that the measures are effective for incident containment.
If the manager did not approve remote access, then it is not the case that the investigation is documented in the report.
Under the condition that the security incident is not contained by the response, the attacker compromised the sensitive files.

(A13 ∨ A14).natural: Either the protocol requires forensic analysis or digital evidence is available from the system.

(A14 → (¬A11 → A12)).natural: If digital evidence is available from the system, then, provided that the manager did not approve remote access, the investigation is documented in the report.

(A16 ∨ (¬(A14 → (¬A11 → A12)) → A15)).prover9_expression: (completed(incident_report, deadline) | (-(available(digital_evidence, system) -> (-approved(remote_access, manager) -> documented(investigation, report))) -> preserved(evidence_chain, integrity)))
(A16 ∨ (¬(A14 → (¬A11 → A12)) → A15)).natural: Either the incident report is completed by the deadline, or if it is not the case that the availability of digital evidence from the system implies that, without manager approval of remote access, the investigation is documented in the report, then the evidence chain is preserved with integrity.

(A17 → A16).natural: Should the lead investigator be assigned to the case, then the incident report is completed by the deadline.

(A17 ∨ A18).natural: Either the lead investigator is assigned to the case or the analysis task is delegated to the specialist.

(A18 → (¬(A14 → (¬A11 → A12)) → A15)).prover9_expression: (delegated(analysis_task, specialist) -> (-(available(digital_evidence, system) -> (-approved(remote_access, manager) -> documented(investigation, report))) -> preserved(evidence_chain, integrity)))
(A18 → (¬(A14 → (¬A11 → A12)) → A15)).natural: If the analysis task is delegated to the specialist, then, whenever it is not true that the availability of digital evidence from the system implies that, without manager approval of remote access, the investigation is documented in the report, the evidence chain is preserved with integrity.

(A2 → A3).natural: Provided that the employee device is authorized to use the network, the software update is compliant with the policy.

(A2 → A4).natural: If the employee device is authorized to use the network, then the backup data is encrypted using the algorithm.

(A2 ∨ (A1 → G)).natural: Either the employee device is authorized to use the network or, when the monitoring system detects a security breach, the security incident is contained by the response.

(A20 → G).natural: Under the condition that the analyst reviewed the access logs, the security incident is contained by the response.

(A20 ∨ A21).natural: Either the analyst reviewed the access logs or the expert examined the network traffic.

(A21 → G).natural: Provided that the expert examined the network traffic, the security incident is contained by the response.

(A22 → A20).natural: If the monitoring identified suspicious activity, then the analyst reviewed the access logs.

(A22 ∨ A23).natural: Either the monitoring identified suspicious activity or the system detected unauthorized access.

(A23 → A21).natural: Should the system detect unauthorized access, then the expert examined the network traffic.

(A24 → (A22 ∨ A23)).natural: Whenever the procedure requires log analysis, it follows that either the monitoring identified suspicious activity or the system detected unauthorized access.

(A25 → (A24 → (A22 ∨ A23))).natural: If the tool automated log processing, then, under the condition that the procedure requires log analysis, either the monitoring identified suspicious activity or the system detected unauthorized access.

(A25 ∨ A26).natural: Either the tool automated log processing or the analyst performed a manual log review.

(A26 → (A24 → (A22 ∨ A23))).natural: Provided that the analyst performed a manual log review, if the procedure requires log analysis, then either the monitoring identified suspicious activity or the system detected unauthorized access.

(A26 → A27).natural: If the analyst performed a manual log review, then the log inspection is completed within the timeframe.

(A27 → (A24 → (A22 ∨ A23))).natural: Should the log inspection be completed within the timeframe, then, whenever the procedure requires log analysis, either the monitoring identified suspicious activity or the system detected unauthorized access.

(A29 → G).natural: Under the condition that the backup recovery process is tested, the security incident is contained by the response.

(A29 ∨ A30).natural: Either the backup recovery process is tested or the data integrity of the backup is verified.

(A30 → G).natural: If the data integrity of the backup is verified, then the security incident is contained by the response.

(A32 → (¬(A29 ∨ A30) → A31)).prover9_expression: (implemented(security_patch, system) -> (-(tested(backup_recovery, process) | verified(data_integrity, backup)) -> restored(system_operation, normal)))
(A32 → (¬(A29 ∨ A30) → A31)).natural: Provided that the security patch is implemented on the system, if it is not the case that either the backup recovery process is tested or the data integrity of the backup is verified, then the system operation is restored to normal.

(A32 → A33).natural: Should the security patch be implemented on the system, then the patch update is deployed across the network.

(A33 → (¬(A29 ∨ A30) → A31)).prover9_expression: (deployed(patch_update, network) -> (-(tested(backup_recovery, process) | verified(data_integrity, backup)) -> restored(system_operation, normal)))
(A33 → (¬(A29 ∨ A30) → A31)).natural: If the patch update is deployed across the network, then, under the condition that neither the backup recovery process is tested nor the data integrity of the backup is verified, the system operation is restored to normal.

(A35 → A31).natural: Whenever the admin initiated the rollback procedure, the system operation is restored to normal.

(A35 → A36).natural: If the admin initiated the rollback procedure, then the team executed the rollback plan.

(A36 → A31).natural: Provided that the team executed the rollback plan, the system operation is restored to normal.

(A39 → A40).natural: Should access rights be conflicting with the policy, then privileged access is granted to the user.

(A39 → ¬A40).natural: If access rights are conflicting with the policy, then it is not the case that privileged access is granted to the user.

(A39 ∨ (¬(¬(A29 ∨ A30) → A37) → A38)).prover9_expression: (conflicting(access_rights, policy) | (-(-(tested(backup_recovery, process) | verified(data_integrity, backup)) -> affected(business_operation, incident)) -> minimized(disruption_time, response)))
(A39 ∨ (¬(¬(A29 ∨ A30) → A37) → A38)).natural: Either access rights are conflicting with the policy or, if it is not true that the absence of both testing the backup recovery process and verifying the data integrity of the backup implies the incident affected business operation, then the response minimized disruption time.

(A4 → A3).natural: Under the condition that the backup data is encrypted using the algorithm, the software update is compliant with the policy.

(A41 → (A39 → A40)).natural: If the admin resolved the permission conflict, then, whenever access rights are conflicting with the policy, privileged access is granted to the user.

(A41 ∨ A42).natural: Either the admin resolved the permission conflict or the access issue is escalated to management.

(A42 → (A39 → A40)).natural: Provided that the access issue is escalated to management, if access rights are conflicting with the policy, then privileged access is granted to the user.

(A43 → A41).natural: Should the audit identify a permission violation, then the admin resolved the permission conflict.

(A43 → A45).natural: If the audit identified a permission violation, then the access control policy is corrected.

(A43 ∨ A44).natural: Either the audit identified a permission violation or the monitor discovered privilege abuse.

(A44 → A42).natural: Under the condition that the monitor discovered privilege abuse, the access issue is escalated to management.

(A45 → A41).natural: Whenever the access control policy is corrected, the admin resolved the permission conflict.

(A46 → (A32 → A33)).natural: If the team lead coordinated the response effort, then, provided that the security patch is implemented on the system, the patch update is deployed across the network.

(A47 → (A46 → (A32 → A33))).natural: Should the team establish a communication channel, then, under the condition that the team lead coordinated the response effort, if the security patch is implemented on the system, the patch update is deployed across the network.

(A47 ∨ A48).natural: Either the team established a communication channel or status updates are maintained for management.

(A48 → (A46 → (A32 → A33))).natural: Provided that status updates are maintained for management, if the team lead coordinated the response effort, then, whenever the security patch is implemented on the system, the patch update is deployed across the network.

(A51 → A50).natural: If the isolation protocol is implemented on the network, then the measures are effective for incident containment.

(A51 → A52).natural: Under the condition that the isolation protocol is implemented on the network, the team activated the incident response plan.

(A52 → A50).natural: Should the team activate the incident response plan, then the measures are effective for incident containment.

(A53 ∨ (A52 → A50)).natural: Either the system achieved successful breach prevention or, if the team activated the incident response plan, the measures are effective for incident containment.

(A6 → A8).natural: Whenever antivirus is installed on the workstation, the antivirus is updated with the latest definition.

(A6 → ¬A5).natural: If antivirus is installed on the workstation, then it is not the case that the attacker compromised the sensitive files.

(A6 ∨ A7).natural: Either antivirus is installed on the workstation or the firewall is configured for the network.

(A7 → ¬A5).natural: Provided that the firewall is configured for the network, the attacker did not compromise the sensitive files.

(A8 → ¬A5).natural: Under the condition that the antivirus is updated with the latest definition, the attacker did not compromise the sensitive files.

(¬(A14 → (¬A11 → A12)) → A15).prover9_expression: (-(available(digital_evidence, system) -> (-approved(remote_access, manager) -> documented(investigation, report))) -> preserved(evidence_chain, integrity))
(¬(A14 → (¬A11 → A12)) → A15).natural: Should it not be true that the availability of digital evidence from the system implies that, without manager approval of remote access, the investigation is documented in the report, then the evidence chain is preserved with integrity.

(¬(A14 → (¬A11 → A12)) → ¬A15).natural: If it is not the case that the availability of digital evidence from the system implies that, without manager approval of remote access, the investigation is documented in the report, then it is not the case that the evidence chain is preserved with integrity.

(¬(A18 → (¬(A14 → (¬A11 → A12)) → A15)).prover9_expression: (-(delegated(analysis_task, specialist) -> (-(available(digital_evidence, system) -> (-approved(remote_access, manager) -> documented(investigation, report))) -> preserved(evidence_chain, integrity))) -> missed(reporting_deadline, team))
(¬(A18 → (¬(A14 → (¬A11 → A12)) → A15)).natural: Provided that it is not true that delegating the analysis task to the specialist implies that, if the availability of digital evidence from the system does not lead to documenting the investigation in the report without manager approval of remote access, then the evidence chain is preserved with integrity, the team missed the reporting deadline.

(¬(A27 → (A24 → (A22 ∨ A23))) → A28).prover9_expression: (-(completed(log_inspection, timeframe) -> (required(log_analysis, procedure) -> (identified(suspicious_activity, monitoring) | detected(unauthorized_access, system)))) -> missed(critical_event, review))
(¬(A27 → (A24 → (A22 ∨ A23))) → A28).natural: If it is not the case that completing the log inspection within the timeframe implies that, whenever the procedure requires log analysis, either the monitoring identified suspicious activity or the system detected unauthorized access, then the review missed a critical event.

(¬(A29 ∨ A30) → A31).natural: Under the condition that neither the backup recovery process is tested nor the data integrity of the backup is verified, the system operation is restored to normal.

(¬(A29 ∨ A30) → A35).natural: Should it be that neither the backup recovery process is tested nor the data integrity of the backup is verified, then the admin initiated the rollback procedure.

(¬(A29 ∨ A30) → A37).natural: If it is not the case that either the backup recovery process is tested or the data integrity of the backup is verified, then the incident affected business operation.

(¬(A29 ∨ A30) → ¬A37).natural: Provided that neither the backup recovery process is tested nor the data integrity of the backup is verified, it is not the case that the incident affected business operation.

(¬(A32 → A33) → A34).natural: Whenever it is not true that implementing the security patch on the system leads to deploying the patch update across the network, the patch caused a system outage.

(¬(A47 → (A46 → (A32 → A33))) → A49).prover9_expression: (-(established(communication_channel, team) -> (coordinated(response_effort, team_lead) -> (implemented(security_patch, system) -> deployed(patch_update, network)))) -> delayed(response_time, communication))
(¬(A47 → (A46 → (A32 → A33))) → A49).natural: Should it not be the case that establishing a communication channel by the team implies that, under the condition that the team lead coordinated the response effort, if the security patch is implemented on the system, the patch update is deployed across the network, then communication delayed the response time.

(¬(A47 → (A46 → (A32 → A33))) → ¬A49).prover9_expression: (-(established(communication_channel, team) -> (coordinated(response_effort, team_lead) -> (implemented(security_patch, system) -> deployed(patch_update, network)))) -> -delayed(response_time, communication))
(¬(A47 → (A46 → (A32 → A33))) → ¬A49).natural: If it is not true that establishing a communication channel by the team implies that, provided the team lead coordinated the response effort, whenever the security patch is implemented on the system, the patch update is deployed across the network, then it is not the case that communication delayed the response time.

(¬(A6 → A8) → A9).natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that installing antivirus on the workstation leads to updating the antivirus with the latest definition, the scanner identified a vulnerability.

(¬(A6 → A8) → ¬A9).natural: Provided that it is not true that installing antivirus on the workstation implies updating the antivirus with the latest definition, it is not the case that the scanner identified a vulnerability.

(¬(¬(A29 ∨ A30) → A37) → A38).prover9_expression: (-(-(tested(backup_recovery, process) | verified(data_integrity, backup)) -> affected(business_operation, incident)) -> minimized(disruption_time, response))
(¬(¬(A29 ∨ A30) → A37) → A38).natural: Should it not be the case that the absence of both testing the backup recovery process and verifying the data integrity of the backup implies the incident affected business operation, then the response minimized disruption time.

(¬(¬(A29 ∨ A30) → A37) → ¬A38).prover9_expression: (-(-(tested(backup_recovery, process) | verified(data_integrity, backup)) -> affected(business_operation, incident)) -> -minimized(disruption_time, response))
(¬(¬(A29 ∨ A30) → A37) → ¬A38).natural: If it is not true that the lack of either testing the backup recovery process or verifying the data integrity of the backup leads to the incident affecting business operation, then it is not the case that the response minimized disruption time.

(¬(¬(A47 → (A46 → (A32 → A33))) → ¬A49).prover9_expression: (-(-(established(communication_channel, team) -> (coordinated(response_effort, team_lead) -> (implemented(security_patch, system) -> deployed(patch_update, network)))) -> -delayed(response_time, communication)) -> effective(incident_containment, measures))
(¬(¬(A47 → (A46 → (A32 → A33))) → ¬A49).natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that the failure of establishing a communication channel by the team to imply that, with the team lead coordinating the response effort, if the security patch is implemented on the system, the patch update is deployed across the network, leads to communication not delaying the response time, the measures are effective for incident containment.

(¬(¬(A47 → (A46 → (A32 → A33))) → ¬A49).prover9_expression: (-(-(established(communication_channel, team) -> (coordinated(response_effort, team_lead) -> (implemented(security_patch, system) -> deployed(patch_update, network)))) -> -delayed(response_time, communication)) -> implemented(isolation_protocol, network))
(¬(¬(A47 → (A46 → (A32 → A33))) → ¬A49).natural: Provided that it is not true that the absence of the implication from establishing a communication channel by the team to the coordinated deployment of the patch update, given the conditions, implies that communication did not delay the response time, the isolation protocol is implemented on the network.

(¬(¬(A47 → (A46 → (A32 → A33))) → ¬A49).prover9_expression: (-(-(established(communication_channel, team) -> (coordinated(response_effort, team_lead) -> (implemented(security_patch, system) -> deployed(patch_update, network)))) -> -delayed(response_time, communication)) -> -effective(incident_containment, measures))
(¬(¬(A47 → (A46 → (A32 → A33))) → ¬A49).natural: Should it not be the case that the lack of the implication from the team establishing a communication channel to the patch deployment under coordination implies that communication did not delay the response time, then it is not the case that the measures are effective for incident containment.

(¬A11 → A12).natural: Whenever the manager did not approve remote access, the investigation is documented in the report.

(¬A11 → ¬A12).natural: If the manager did not approve remote access, then it is not the case that the investigation is documented in the report.

(¬G → A5).natural: Under the condition that the security incident is not contained by the response, the attacker compromised the sensitive files.

A1.natural: The monitoring system detected a security breach.

A10.natural: The team initiated the incident response.

A32.natural: The security patch is implemented on the system.

A46.natural: The team lead coordinated the response effort.

G.natural: The security incident is contained by the response.

¬A16.natural: It is not the case that the incident report is completed by the deadline.

¬A19.natural: It is not the case that the team missed the reporting deadline.

¬A2.natural: It is not the case that the employee device is authorized to use the network.

¬A28.natural: It is not the case that the review missed a critical event.

¬A3.natural: It is not the case that the software update is compliant with the policy.

¬A31.natural: It is not the case that the system operation is restored to normal.

¬A34.natural: It is not the case that the patch caused a system outage.

¬A39.natural: It is not the case that access rights are conflicting with the policy.

¬A5.natural: It is not the case that the attacker compromised the sensitive files.

¬A53.natural: It is not the case that the system achieved successful breach prevention.
